venue.name: Adams Mill Restaurant Upstairs Pub

item.description:
I know it's Father's Day and since my father is the one who taught me to love hiking, I thought I'd offer two hikes for those, like me, who no longer have a dad around to celebrate wtih.

Hike #1

Meet at 1:30 at the parking lot at the Adams Mill Restaurant. When you come into the lot, cross in front of the restaurant and you'll see a second lot up in the back to the left of the restaurant. We'll meet up there, as that is where the trail starts. Leashed dogs welcome.

Here's a description of the trail:

Adams Mill Trail (1.93 mile loop) Park at restaurant, 165 Adams Street. Trail starts to left of restaurant, follow along dike to river, up river to railroad trestle, across trestle to steps and downstream on Eighth Utilities property, along river to Adams Street, along sidewalk to parking lot. Difficult walk, steep hills, narrow ledges, beautiful deep hemlock and pine forest, scenic sandstone gorge, need boots and walking stick, view old mill and dam.

Hope to see you there!

=== Legal Stuff ===
By clicking on "Yes" or "Maybe" for this event you agree, warrant, and covenant as follows:

In consideration for accepting this entry, I, the registrant, intending to be legally bound, hereby, for myself, my heirs, my executors and administrators, do waive and release any and all rights for damages I may have against any parties or persons connected with the Hartford Area Hiking meetup group for and related to the above listed event. I attest and verify that I am physically fit to participate in any portion of this above listed event. I grant Hartford Area Hiking permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of this event for any purpose.
----------------------------------------------------------------
